recipes.title: Igado
recipes.description: A pork ulam that is mixed with coconut and bell peppers potatoes and pork liver

recipes.title: Pork Adobo
recipes.description: Pork adobo, also known as adobong baboy, is a flavorful, hearty Filipino dish of pork braised in vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, and other spices, and served over rice

recipes.title: Litson
recipes.description: Lechon is a popular Filipino dish of a whole pig that's spit-roasted over charcoal and seasoned with oil and spices. It's known for its crispy, golden-brown skin and tender, juicy meat. Lechon is often served at celebrations like birthdays, Christmas dinners, fiestas, and anniversaries.

recipes.title: Lumpiang Shanghai
recipes.description: Lumpiang Shanghai is a basic type of lumpia, which is a Filipino fried spring roll. It's usually smaller and thinner than other lumpia varieties. The rolls are made by wrapping a mixture of ground meat, vegetables, and garlic in a thin egg crÃªpe and then deep-frying them.

recipes.title: Adobong Kangkong
recipes.description: Adobong Kangkong Vegan is a plant-based twist on the classic Filipino dish, made with tender water spinach (kangkong) simmered in a savory blend of soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and onions. This vegan-friendly recipe omits traditional animal-based ingredients like meat or fish sauce, relying instead on seasonings and aromatics to create a flavorful and hearty dish. Perfect as a side or a main, it pairs beautifully with steamed rice for a simple yet satisfying meal.
